title: Biological Qubits Atlas: Fluorescent Proteins & Optical Biosensors Extension (v1.2.0)
description: A curated atlas of quantum-coherent and optical systems operating in, or compatible with, biological environments (in vitro, in cellulo, in vivo). Version 1.2.0 extends the dataset with comprehensive fluorescent protein (FP) and optical biosensor data harvested from FPbase, UniProt, PDB, and PubMed Central. This release includes ≥50 FP-like entries with ≥25 measured contrast ratios (ΔF/F₀, on/off), alongside legacy multi-modality systems (NV centers, SiC, NMR, ESR). Features: automated ETL pipeline, PMC contrast extraction (OA-only), computed brightness proxies, complete provenance tracking (SHA256 checksums), quality control with blocking thresholds, stable versioned interface for computational design (fp-qubit-design).
notes: Version 1.2.0 includes: (1) External harvest pipeline (FPbase API, UniProt, PDB/PDBe, PMC OA); (2) Multi-modality classification (FP-like vs color centers/NMR/ESR); (3) PMC contrast extraction with regex parsing; (4) Computed brightness proxies (QY × ε); (5) Two datasets: atlas_all_real.csv (multi-modality), atlas_fp_optical.csv (FP/biosensors only); (6) Complete metadata (TRAINING.METADATA.json) with schema, licenses, provenance; (7) QA audit with blocking thresholds (≥50 total, ≥25 measured); (8) Consumer documentation (CONSUMERS.md) with stable interface contract. Assets: atlas_fp_optical.csv, atlas_all_real.csv, TRAINING.METADATA.json, audit reports.
